region.description: The data center for which your New Relic account is configured. Only one region per provider block is permitted.

name.description: Name of the account to be created

region.description: A description of what this parsing rule represents.

account_id.description: The New Relic account ID where you want to create alert channels.

type.description: (Required) The type of channel. One of: (email, opsgenie, pagerduty, slack, user, victorops, webhook).

api_key.description: The API key for integrating with OpsGenie.

auth_password.description: Specifies an authentication password for use with a channel. Supported by the webhook channel type.

auth_type.description: Specifies an authentication method for use with a channel. Supported by the webhook channel type. Only HTTP basic authentication is currently supported via the value BASIC.

auth_username.description: Specifies an authentication username for use with a channel. Supported by the webhook channel type.

base_url.description: The base URL of the webhook destination.

channel.description: The Slack channel to send notifications to.

headers.description: A map of key/value pairs that represents extra HTTP headers to be sent along with the webhook payload.

headers_string.description: Use instead of headers if the desired payload is more complex than a list of key/value pairs (e.g. a set of headers that makes use of nested objects). The value provided should be a valid JSON string with escaped double quotes. Conflicts with headers.

include_json_attachment.description: true or false. Flag for whether or not to attach a JSON document containing information about the associated alert to the email that is sent to recipients.

key.description: The key for integrating with VictorOps.

payload.description: A map of key/value pairs that represents the webhook payload. Must provide payload_type if setting this argument.

payload_string.description: Use instead of payload if the desired payload is more complex than a list of key/value pairs (e.g. a payload that makes use of nested objects). The value provided should be a valid JSON string with escaped double quotes. Conflicts with payload.

payload_type.description: Can either be application/json or application/x-www-form-urlencoded. The payload_type argument is required if payload is set.

recipients.description: A set of recipients for targeting notifications. Multiple values are comma separated.

region.description: The data center region to store your data. Valid values are US and EU. Default is US.

route_key.description: The route key for integrating with VictorOps.

service_key.description: Specifies the service key for integrating with Pagerduty.

tags.description: A set of tags for targeting notifications. Multiple values are comma separated.

teams.description: A set of teams for targeting notifications. Multiple values are comma separated.

user_id.description: The user ID for use with the user channel type.

block.description: The configuration block for the alert channel.

condition_scope.description: One of (application, instance). Choose application for most scenarios. If you are using the JVM plugin in New Relic, the instance setting allows your condition to trigger for specific app instances.

entities.description: The instance IDs associated with this condition.

entity_guid.description: The unique entity identifier of the condition in New Relic.

gc_metric.description: A valid Garbage Collection metric e.g. GC/G1 Young Generation. This is required if you are using apm_jvm_metric with gc_cpu_time condition type.

metric.description: The metric field accepts parameters based on the type set.

name.description: The title of the condition. Must be between 1 and 128 characters, inclusive.

policy_id.description: The ID of the policy where this condition should be used.

runbook_url.description: Runbook URL to display in notifications.

type.description: The type of condition. One of: (browser_metric, mobile_metric, servers_metric, apm_app_metric, apm_jvm_metric, apm_kt_metric).

user_defined_metric.description: A custom metric to be evaluated.

user_defined_value_function.description: One of: (average, min, max, total, sample_size, percent, rate).

violation_close_timer.description: Automatically close instance-based incidents, including JVM health metric incidents, after the number of hours specified. Must be between 1 and 720 hours.

duration.description: In minutes, must be in the range of 5 to 120, inclusive.

operator.description: One of (above, below, equal). Defaults to equal.

priority.description: One of (critical, warning). Defaults to critical.

account_id.description: The account id of the MutingRule..

operator.description: The operator used to combine all the MutingRuleConditions within the group.
The operator used to compare the attribute's value with the supplied value(s).

values.description: The value(s) to compare against the attribute's value.

block.description: The individual MutingRuleConditions within the group.
The condition that defines which incidents to target.

end_repeat.description: The datetime stamp when the MutingRule schedule should stop repeating.

end_time.description: The datetime stamp representing when the MutingRule should end.

repeat.description: The frequency the MutingRule schedule repeats. One of [DAILY, WEEKLY, MONTHLY]

repeat_count.description: The number of times the MutingRule schedule should repeat.

start_time.description: The datetime stamp representing when the MutingRule should start.

time_zone.description: The time zone that applies to the MutingRule schedule.

weekly_repeat_days.description: The day(s) of the week that a MutingRule should repeat when the repeat field is set to WEEKLY.

block.description: The time window when the MutingRule should actively mute incidents.

account_id.description: The New Relic account ID to operate on.

channel_ids.description: An array of channel IDs (integers) to assign to the policy. Adding or removing channel IDs from this array will result in a new alert policy resource being created and the old one being destroyed. Also note that channel IDs cannot be imported via terraform import.

incident_preference.description: The rollup strategy for the policy. Options include: PER_POLICY, PER_CONDITION, or PER_CONDITION_AND_TARGET. The default is PER_POLICY.

account_id.description: The New Relic account ID where you want to link the channel to.

channel_ids.description: Array of channel IDs to apply to the specified policy. We recommended sorting channel IDs in ascending order to avoid drift your Terraform state.

account_id.description: The account ID.

cookies_enabled.description: Configure cookies. The default is enabled: true.

distributed_tracing_enabled.description: Configure distributed tracing in browser apps. The default is enabled: true.

guid.description: The GUID of the browser application.

js_config.description: JavaScript configuration of the browser application encoded into a string.

loader_type.description: Determines which browser loader is configured. The default is "SPA".

name.description: The name of the application to monitor.

account_id.description: The ID of the account in New Relic.

linked_account_id.description: The ID of the linked AwsGovCloud account in New Relic

aws_regions.description: Specify each AWS region that includes the resources that you want to monitor

fetch_extended_inventory.description: Determine if extra inventory data be collected or not. May affect total data collection time and contribute to the Cloud provider API rate limit.

fetch_tags.description: Specify if tags should be collected. May affect total data collection time and contribute to the Cloud provider API rate limit.

load_balancer_prefixes.description: Specify each name or prefix for the LBs that you want to monitor. Filter values are case-sensitive.

metrics_polling_interval.description: The data polling interval in seconds

tag_key.description: Specify a Tag key associated with the resources that you want to monitor. Filter values are case-sensitive.

tag_value.description: Specify a Tag value associated with the resources that you want to monitor. Filter values are case-sensitive.

account_id.description: accountID of newrelic account

project_id.description: project id of the Gcp account

account_id.description: The account id associated with the data partition rule.

deleted.description: Whether or not this data partition rule is deleted. Deleting a data partition rule does not delete the already persisted data. This data will be retained for a given period of time specified in the retention policy field.

description.description: The description of the data partition rule.

enabled.description: Whether or not this data partition rule is enabled.

nrql.description: The NRQL to match events for this data partition rule. Logs matching this criteria will be routed to the specified data partition.

retention_policy.description: The retention policy of the data partition data.

target_data_partition.description: The name of the data partition where logs will be allocated once the rule is enabled.

guid.description: The guid of the entity to tag.

block.description: A set of key-value pairs to represent a tag. For example: Team:TeamName

account_id.description: Account with the event and where the metrics will be put.

description.description: Provides additional information about the rule.

enabled.description: True means this rule is enabled. False means the rule is currently not creating metrics.

name.description: The name of the rule. This must be unique within an account.

nrql.description: Explains how to create metrics from events.

rule_id.description: The id, uniquely identifying the rule.

comparison.description: The operator used to evaluate the threshold value. Valid values are above, below, and equal. Supported by the infra_metric and infra_process_running condition types.

created_at.description: The timestamp the alert condition was created.

description.description: The description of the Infrastructure alert condition.

enabled.description: Whether the condition is turned on or off. Valid values are true and false. Defaults to true.

entity_guid.description: The unique entity identifier of the condition in New Relic.

event.description: The metric event; for example, SystemSample or StorageSample. Supported by the infra_metric condition type.

integration_provider.description: For alerts on integrations, use this instead of event. Supported by the infra_metric condition type.

policy_id.description: The ID of the alert policy where this condition should be used.

process_where.description: Any filters applied to processes; for example: commandName = 'java'. Supported by the infra_process_running condition type.

runbook_url.description: Runbook URL to display in notifications.

select.description: The attribute name to identify the metric being targeted; for example, cpuPercent, diskFreePercent, or memoryResidentSizeBytes. The underlying API will automatically populate this value for Infrastructure integrations (for example diskFreePercent), so make sure to explicitly include this value to avoid diff issues. Supported by the infra_metric condition type.

type.description: The type of Infrastructure alert condition. Valid values are infra_process_running, infra_metric, and infra_host_not_reporting.

updated_at.description: The timestamp the alert condition was last updated.

violation_close_timer.description: Determines how much time, in hours, will pass before an incident is automatically closed. Valid values are 1, 2, 4, 8, 12, 24, 48, or 72

where.description: If applicable, this identifies any Infrastructure host filters used; for example: hostname LIKE '%cassandra%'.

block.description: Identifies the threshold parameters for opening a critical alert incident.
Identifies the threshold parameters for opening a warning alert incident.

timestamp.description: Must be a Unix epoch timestamp. You can define timestamps either in seconds or in milliseconds.

type.description: The event's name. Can be a combination of alphanumeric characters, underscores, and colons.
Specify the type for the attribute value. This is useful when passing integer or float values to Insights. Allowed values are string, int, or float. Defaults to string.

block.description: An attribute to include in your event payload. Multiple attribute blocks can be defined for an event.

account_id.description: The account id associated with the obfuscation expression.

attribute.description: The parsing rule will apply to value of this attribute. If field is not provided, value will default to message.

deleted.description: Whether or not this rule is deleted.

enabled.description: Whether or not this rule is enabled.

grok.description: The Grok of what to parse.

lucene.description: The Lucene to match events to the parsing rule.

name.description: A description of what this parsing rule represents.

nrql.description: The NRQL to match events to the parsing rule.

account_id.description: The account id of the channel.

active.description: Indicates whether the channel is active.

product.description: (Required) The type of the channel product. One of: (DISCUSSIONS, ERROR_TRACKING, IINT).

type.description: (Required) The type of the channel. One of: (WEBHOOK, EMAIL, SERVICENOW_INCIDENTS, PAGERDUTY_ACCOUNT_INTEGRATION, PAGERDUTY_SERVICE_INTEGRATION, JIRA_CLASSIC, SLACK, SLACK_COLLABORATION, SLACK_LEGACY, MOBILE_PUSH, EVENT_BRIDGE).

account_id.description: The account ID under which to put the destination.

active.description: Indicates whether the destination is active.

last_sent.description: The last time a notification was sent.

type.description: (Required) The type of the destination. One of: (WEBHOOK, EMAIL, SERVICE_NOW, PAGERDUTY_ACCOUNT_INTEGRATION, PAGERDUTY_SERVICE_INTEGRATION, JIRA, SLACK, SLACK_COLLABORATION, SLACK_LEGACY, MOBILE_PUSH, EVENT_BRIDGE).

block.description: Basic username and password authentication credentials.

account_id.description: The New Relic account ID for managing your NRQL alert conditions.

aggregation_delay.description: How long we wait for data that belongs in each aggregation window. Depending on your data, a longer delay may increase accuracy but delay notifications. Use aggregationDelay with the EVENT_FLOW and CADENCE aggregation methods.

aggregation_method.description: The method that determines when we consider an aggregation window to be complete so that we can evaluate the signal for incidents. Default is EVENT_FLOW.

aggregation_timer.description: How long we wait after each data point arrives to make sure we've processed the whole batch. Use aggregationTimer with the EVENT_TIMER aggregation method.

aggregation_window.description: The duration of the time window used to evaluate the NRQL query, in seconds.

baseline_direction.description: The baseline direction of a baseline NRQL alert condition. Valid values are: 'LOWER_ONLY', 'UPPER_AND_LOWER', 'UPPER_ONLY' (case insensitive).

close_violations_on_expiration.description: Whether to close all open incidents when the signal expires.

description.description: The description of the NRQL alert condition.

enabled.description: Whether or not to enable the alert condition.

entity_guid.description: The unique entity identifier of the NRQL Condition in New Relic.

evaluation_delay.description: How long we wait until the signal starts evaluating. The maximum delay is 7200 seconds (120 minutes)

expiration_duration.description: The amount of time (in seconds) to wait before considering the signal expired.  Must be in the range of 30 to 172800 (inclusive)

fill_option.description: Which strategy to use when filling gaps in the signal. If static, the 'fill value' will be used for filling gaps in the signal. Valid values are: 'NONE', 'LAST_VALUE', or 'STATIC' (case insensitive).

fill_value.description: If using the 'static' fill option, this value will be used for filling gaps in the signal.

open_violation_on_expiration.description: Whether to create a new incident to capture that the signal expired.

policy_id.description: The ID of the policy where this condition should be used.

runbook_url.description: Runbook URL to display in notifications.

slide_by.description: The duration of overlapping timewindows used to smooth the chart line, in seconds. Must be a factor of `aggregation_window` and less than the aggregation window. It should be greater or equal to 30 seconds if `aggregation_window` is less than or equal to 3600 seconds, or greater or equal to `aggregation_window / 120` if `aggregation_window` is greater than 3600 seconds.

type.description: The type of NRQL alert condition to create. Valid values are: 'static', 'baseline'.

violation_time_limit.description: Sets a time limit, in hours, that will automatically force-close a long-lasting incident after the time limit you select. Possible values are 'ONE_HOUR', 'TWO_HOURS', 'FOUR_HOURS', 'EIGHT_HOURS', 'TWELVE_HOURS', 'TWENTY_FOUR_HOURS', 'THIRTY_DAYS' (case insensitive).

violation_time_limit_seconds.description: Sets a time limit, in seconds, that will automatically force-close a long-lasting incident after the time limit you select.  Must be in the range of 300 to 2592000 (inclusive)

duration.description: In minutes, must be in the range of 1 to 120 (inclusive).

operator.description: One of (above, above_or_equals, below, below_or_equals, equals, not_equals). Defaults to 'equals'.

threshold.description: For baseline conditions must be in range [1, 1000].

threshold_duration.description: The duration, in seconds, that the threshold must violate in order to create an incident. Value must be a multiple of the 'aggregation_window' (which has a default of 60 seconds). Value must be within 120-86400 seconds for baseline conditions, and within 60-86400 seconds for static conditions

threshold_occurrences.description: The criteria for how many data points must be in violation for the specified threshold duration. Valid values are: 'ALL' or 'AT_LEAST_ONCE' (case insensitive).

block.description: A condition term with priority set to critical.

evaluation_offset.description: NRQL queries are evaluated in one-minute time windows. The start time depends on the value you provide in the NRQL condition's `evaluation_offset`.

since_value.description: NRQL queries are evaluated in one-minute time windows. The start time depends on the value you provide in the NRQL condition's `since_value`.

duration.description: In minutes, must be in the range of 1 to 120 (inclusive).

operator.description: One of (above, above_or_equals, below, below_or_equals, equals, not_equals). Defaults to 'equals'.

priority.description: One of (critical, warning). Defaults to 'critical'. At least one condition term must have priority set to 'critical'.

threshold.description: For baseline conditions must be in range [1, 1000].

threshold_duration.description: The duration, in seconds, that the threshold must violate in order to create an incident. Value must be a multiple of the 'aggregation_window' (which has a default of 60 seconds). Value must be within 120-86400 seconds for baseline conditions, and within 60-86400 seconds for static conditions

threshold_occurrences.description: The criteria for how many data points must be in violation for the specified threshold duration. Valid values are: 'ALL' or 'AT_LEAST_ONCE' (case insensitive).

block.description: A set of terms for this condition. Max 2 terms allowed - at least one 1 critical term and 1 optional warning term.

duration.description: In minutes, must be in the range of 1 to 120 (inclusive).

operator.description: One of (above, above_or_equals, below, below_or_equals, equals, not_equals). Defaults to 'equals'.

threshold.description: For baseline conditions must be in range [1, 1000].

threshold_duration.description: The duration, in seconds, that the threshold must violate in order to create an incident. Value must be a multiple of the 'aggregation_window' (which has a default of 60 seconds). Value must be within 120-86400 seconds for baseline conditions, and within 60-86400 seconds for static conditions

threshold_occurrences.description: The criteria for how many data points must be in violation for the specified threshold duration. Valid values are: 'ALL' or 'AT_LEAST_ONCE' (case insensitive).

block.description: A condition term with priority set to warning.

account_id.description: Account with the NRQL drop rule will be put.

action.description: The drop rule action (drop_data, drop_attributes, or drop_attributes_from_metric_aggregates).

description.description: Provides additional information about the rule.

nrql.description: Explains which data to apply the drop rule to.

rule_id.description: The id, uniquely identifying the rule.

account_id.description: The account id associated with the obfuscation expression.
The account id associated with the obfuscation rule.

enabled.description: Whether the rule should be applied or not to incoming data.

filter.description: NRQL for determining whether a given log record should have obfuscation actions applied.

attribute.description: Attribute names for action. An empty list applies the action to all the attributes.

block.description: Actions for the rule. The actions will be applied in the order specified by this list.

permissions.description: Determines who can see or edit the dashboard. Valid values are private, public_read_only, public_read_write. Defaults to public_read_only.

is_multi_selection.description: Indicates whether this variable supports multiple selection or not. Only applies to variables of type NRQL or ENUM.

replacement_strategy.description: Indicates the strategy to apply when replacing a variable in a NRQL query.

title.description: Human-friendly display string for this variable.

type.description: Specifies the data type of the variable and where its possible values may come from.

title.description: A human-friendly display string for this value.

block.description: List of possible values for variables of type ENUM

locations_private.description: List private location GUIDs for which the monitor will run.

locations_public.description: Publicly available location names in which the monitor will run.

period.description: The interval at which this monitor should run. Valid values are EVERY_MINUTE, EVERY_5_MINUTES, EVERY_10_MINUTES, EVERY_15_MINUTES, EVERY_30_MINUTES, EVERY_HOUR, EVERY_6_HOURS, EVERY_12_HOURS, or EVERY_DAY.

period_in_minutes.description: The interval in minutes at which this monitor should run.

status.description: The monitor status (i.e. ENABLED, MUTED, DISABLED). Note: The 'MUTED' status is now deprecated, and support for this value will soon be removed from the Terraform Provider in an upcoming release. It is highly recommended for users to refrain from using this value and shift to alternatives.

guid.description: The unique entity identifier of the monitor in New Relic.

locations_public.description: The public location(s) that the monitor will run jobs from.

period.description: The interval at which this monitor should run. Valid values are EVERY_MINUTE, EVERY_5_MINUTES, EVERY_10_MINUTES, EVERY_15_MINUTES, EVERY_30_MINUTES, EVERY_HOUR, EVERY_6_HOURS, EVERY_12_HOURS, or EVERY_DAY.

period_in_minutes.description: The interval in minutes at which this monitor should run.

runtime_type.description: The runtime type that the monitor will run.

runtime_type_version.description: The specific semver version of the runtime type.

script.description: The script that the monitor runs.

script_language.description: The programing language that should execute the script.

status.description: The monitor status (i.e. ENABLED, MUTED, DISABLED). Note: The 'MUTED' status is now deprecated, and support for this value will soon be removed from the Terraform Provider in an upcoming release. It is highly recommended for users to refrain from using this value and shift to alternatives.

type.description: The monitor type. Valid values are SCRIPT_BROWSER, and SCRIPT_API.

guid.description: The unique identifier for the Synthetics private location in New Relic.

vse_password.description: The location's Verified Script Execution password (Only necessary if Verified Script Execution is enabled for the location).

values.description: Values associated with the tag key

block.description: The tags that will be associated with the monitor.

account_id.description: The New Relic account ID where you want to create the secure credential.

key.description: The secure credential's key name. Regardless of the case used in the configuration, the provider will provide an upcased key to the underlying API.

last_updated.description: The time the secure credential was last updated.

account_id.description: ID of the newrelic account.

enable_screenshot_on_failure_and_script.description: Capture a screenshot during job execution.

guid.description: The unique entity identifier of the monitor in New Relic.

locations_public.description: The public location(s) that the monitor will run jobs from.

period.description: The interval at which this monitor should run. Valid values are EVERY_MINUTE, EVERY_5_MINUTES, EVERY_10_MINUTES, EVERY_15_MINUTES, EVERY_30_MINUTES, EVERY_HOUR, EVERY_6_HOURS, EVERY_12_HOURS, or EVERY_DAY.

period_in_minutes.description: The interval in minutes at which this monitor should run.

status.description: The monitor status (i.e. ENABLED, MUTED, DISABLED). Note: The 'MUTED' status is now deprecated, and support for this value will soon be removed from the Terraform Provider in an upcoming release. It is highly recommended for users to refrain from using this value and shift to alternatives.

guid.description: The unique identifier for the Synthetics private location in New Relic.

vse_password.description: The location's Verified Script Execution password (Only necessary if Verified Script Execution is enabled for the location).

ordinal.description: The position of the step within the script ranging from 0-100

type.description: The type of step to be added to the script.

values.description: The metadata values related to the check the step performs.

block.description: The steps that make up the script the monitor will run

values.description: Values associated with the tag key

block.description: The tags that will be associated with the monitor.

account_id.description: The account id of the workflow.

destinations_enabled.description: Indicates whether the destinations are enabled.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the workflow is enabled.

enrichments_enabled.description: Indicates whether the enrichments are enabled.

last_run.description: The last time notification was sent for this workflow.

muting_rules_handling.description: The type of the muting rule handling. One of: (NOTIFY_ALL_ISSUES, DONT_NOTIFY_FULLY_MUTED_ISSUES, DONT_NOTIFY_FULLY_OR_PARTIALLY_MUTED_ISSUES).

notification_triggers.description: List of triggers to notify about in this destination configuration.

type.description: (Required) The type of the destination. One of: (EMAIL, EVENT_BRIDGE, PAGERDUTY_ACCOUNT_INTEGRATION, PAGERDUTY_SERVICE_INTEGRATION, SERVICE_NOW, WEBHOOK, MOBILE_PUSH, SLACK, JIRA).

account_id.description: The account id of the enrichment.

type.description: The type of the enrichment. One of: (NRQL).

block.description: A set of key-value pairs to represent a enrichment configuration.
Enrichments can give additional context on alert notifications by adding NRQL query results to them.

type.description: (Required) The type of the filter. One of: (FILTER, VIEW).

operator.description: The type of the operator. One of: (CONTAINS, DOES_NOT_CONTAIN, DOES_NOT_EQUAL, DOES_NOT_EXACTLY_MATCH, ENDS_WITH, EQUAL, EXACTLY_MATCHES, GREATER_OR_EQUAL, GREATER_THAN, IS, IS_NOT, LESS_OR_EQUAL, LESS_THAN, STARTS_WITH).

account_id.description: The New Relic account ID where you want to create the workload.

composite_entity_search_query.description: The composite query used to compose a dynamic workload.

entity_guids.description: A list of entity GUIDs manually assigned to this workload.

guid.description: The unique entity identifier of the workload in New Relic.

scope_account_ids.description: A list of account IDs that will be used to get entities from.

workload_id.description: The unique entity identifier of the workload.

block.description: A list of search queries that define a dynamic workload.

enabled.description: Whether the automatic status configuration is enabled or not.

group_by.description: The grouping to be applied to the remaining entities.

strategy.description: The rollup strategy that is applied to a group of entities.

threshold_type.description: Type of threshold defined for the rule. This is an optional field that only applies when strategy is WORST_STATUS_WINS. Use a threshold to roll up the worst status only after a certain amount of entities are not operational.

threshold_value.description: Threshold value defined for the rule. This optional field is used in combination with thresholdType. If the threshold type is null, the threshold value will be ignored.

block.description: The input object used to represent a rollup strategy.
An additional meta-rule that can consider all entities that haven't been evaluated by any other rule.

entity_guids.description: A list of entity GUIDs composing the rule.

query.description: The entity search query that is used to perform the search of a group of entities.

block.description: A list of entity search queries used to retrieve the entities that compose the rule.

strategy.description: The rollup strategy that is applied to a group of entities.

threshold_type.description: Type of threshold defined for the rule. This is an optional field that only applies when strategy is WORST_STATUS_WINS. Use a threshold to roll up the worst status only after a certain amount of entities are not operational.

threshold_value.description: Threshold value defined for the rule. This optional field is used in combination with thresholdType. If the threshold type is null, the threshold value will be ignored.

block.description: The input object used to represent a rollup strategy.
An input object used to represent an automatic status configuration.

description.description: A description that provides additional details about the status of the workload.

enabled.description: Whether the static status configuration is enabled or not.

summary.description: A short description of the status of the workload.

block.description: A list of static status configurations. You can only configure one static status for a workload.

account_id.description: The ID of the account in New Relic.

name.description: The name of the account in New Relic.

scope.description: The scope of the account in New Relic.  Valid values are "global" and "in_region".  Defaults to "in_region".

account_id.description: The New Relic account ID where you want to retrieve the alert channel.

name.description: The name of the alert channel in New Relic.

policy_ids.description: A list of policy IDs associated with the alert channel.

type.description: The type of channel. One of: (pagerduty, slack, user, victorops, webhook, email, opsgenie).

account_id.description: The New Relic account ID to operate on.

created_at.description: The time the policy was created.

incident_preference.description: The rollup strategy for the policy. Options include: `PER_POLICY`, `PER_CONDITION`, or `PER_CONDITION_AND_TARGET`. The default is `PER_POLICY`.

name.description: The name of the alert policy in New Relic.

updated_at.description: The time the policy was last updated.

host_ids.description: A list of host IDs associated with the application.

instance_ids.description: A list of instance IDs associated with the application.

name.description: The name of the application in New Relic.

account_id.description: The ID of the New Relic account.

cloud_provider.description: The cloud provider of the account, e.g. aws, gcp, azure

name.description: The name of the cloud account.

account_id.description: The New Relic account ID; if specified, constrains the data source to return an entity belonging to the account with this ID, of all matching entities retrieved.

application_id.description: The domain-specific ID of the entity (only returned for APM and Browser applications).

domain.description: The entity's domain. Valid values are APM, BROWSER, INFRA, MOBILE, SYNTH, and EXT. If not specified, all domains are searched.

ignore_case.description: Ignore case when searching the entity name.

name.description: The name of the entity in New Relic One. The first entity matching this name for the given search parameters will be returned.

serving_apm_application_id.description: The browser-specific ID of the backing APM entity. (only returned for Browser applications)

type.description: The entity's type. Valid values are APPLICATION, DASHBOARD, HOST, MONITOR, SERVICE and WORKLOAD.

block.description: A tag applied to the entity.

name.description: The name of the key transaction in New Relic.

account_id.description: The account ID under which to put the destination.

active.description: Indicates whether the destination is active.

type.description: The type of the destination. One of: (WEBHOOK, EMAIL, SERVICE_NOW, PAGERDUTY_ACCOUNT_INTEGRATION, PAGERDUTY_SERVICE_INTEGRATION, JIRA, SLACK, SLACK_COLLABORATION, SLACK_LEGACY, MOBILE_PUSH, EVENT_BRIDGE).

account_id.description: The account id associated with the obfuscation expression.
The ID of the account in New Relic.

key.description: The key of the queried private location.

name.description: The name of the Synthetics monitor private location.

account_id.description: The New Relic account ID associated with this secure credential.

key.description: The secure credential's key name. Regardless of the case used in the configuration, the provider will provide an upcased key to the underlying API.

last_updated.description: The time the secure credential was last updated.

account_id.description: The account id associated with the test grok.

log_lines.description: The log lines to test the Grok pattern against.

test_grok.description: Test a Grok pattern against a list of log lines.
